metadata.dc:title: Therapeutic options in interstitial pregnancy
metadata.dc:creator: Mora Hervás, Irene
Cusiné López, Laura
Mateu Pruñonosa, J. Carlos
Brescó Torras, Pere
Aznar García, Isabel
Rovira Pampalona, Jennifer
García Grandal, Tamara
metadata.dc:description: Cornual pregnancy is very rare, with an incidence of 2-4% of ectopic pregnancies. As with tubal pregnancy, treatment options include surgery, medical therapy or a combination of both. Currently, there are also other treatment options that are effective. We report a case of cornual pregnancy treated with hysteroscopic resection followed by laparoscopic review, which can be an effective treatment option (AU)
metadata.dc:title: Opciones terapéuticas en el embarazo intersticial
